page.title: 16ANGMERING PARK STUD FARM
page.content:
The stud farm was formed and built in 1937 and it belongs to Lavinia, Duchess of Norfolk. There are 46 horses on the farm, all thoroughbreds.
The farm covers 240 acres and has 19 paddocks. Five people work on the farm. They bring up the horses and train them until they are 18 months old. It costs Â£64 to provide for one horse for one week. On average 14 foals are born each year and trained as racehorses. When the horses are old enough some of them are sold to foreign countries - Japan, USA, Ireland, Australia, France and Germany. There have been some famous horses born and bred on the stud farm. The mare 'Fotheringay' who is now 22 yars old bore a foal worth Â£750,000 which will be named when it is 2 years old.
